information: Participated in technical lectures led by Google engineers on software engineering and computer science fundamentals
Completed guided coding projects and Python-based labs
Collaborated with a Google mentor on technical skill development and resume building
paragraph: I worked as a Student Engineer with Google Code Next Connect, where I completed Python-based projects and collaborated with a Google mentor on software engineering skill development. This was one of my first real exposures to the tech industry and It taught me fundamental concepts that I still use to this day.

information: Evaluated different machine learning models for anomaly detection in DDoS attacks
Implemented experiments to compare Signature-based Detection versus Anomaly-based Detection performance on network traffic data
Analyzed results to identify strengths and limitations of learning-based detection methods
paragraph: I collaborated with my fellow interns to construct a machine learning model that could outperform the current approach of Signature-Based detection in a DDos Attack. We worked on programming an anomaly based model that used K-means Clustering, Gaussian Mixture Model, and One Class Classifiers. Our Model had good results under Accuracy, Recall, and precision which improved the real world case of zero-day threats. We presented our findings to a panel of family and UTD Staff.

information: Participating in hands-on research on autonomous systems, including perception, planning, and control for scaled autonomous vehicles
Working on multi-sensor fusion using camera, LiDAR, and IMU data to detect relevant entities and other agents
Developing algorithms for long-term localization, mapping, and decision-making in dynamic, multi-agent environments
paragraph: I’m currently conducting research in UT Austin’s Autonomous Driving Lab, developing multi-sensor perception and decision-making algorithms for scaled autonomous vehicles. By the end of the semester I will have built 1/10th and 1/5th scale autonomous vehicles.
